description:
Jesse Keating

OpenStack is a well known open source cloud platform providing compute, networking, storage, and other tools as a programmable service. While it may be best known as providing the basis for large public clouds for such vendors as Rackspace and HP, OpenStack is also very useful as a private cloud platform for nearly any sized organization.

From bare metal to containers, from volumes to objects, come get a tour of the various parts of OpenStack and the various ways to stand up an OpenStack service!
title: LinuxFest Northwest 2015: OpenStack -- Not just for Public Clouds!
